scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity. Alex suggests a bit of everything: starting with an outdoor activity, then having dinner, and ending the night at a bar. Monica and Bob have been discussing this, and you notice some tension as they approach you. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'Alex, do you really think we can fit all that in one evening? And Bob here thinks we should just stick to one thing.' Bob nods in agreement, looking a bit annoyed. After considering their input, Alex suggests going with the majority's preference to avoid any conflicts. Monica and Bob now seem to be waiting for a more concrete plan. Alex then proposes to go with Ryan's suggestion of an outdoor team-building activity. Monica and Bob seem to be contemplating this new suggestion. Monica raises an eyebrow, 'An outdoor activity, huh? Well, I guess it's better than nothing. What do you think, Bob?' Bob shrugs, 'I suppose it could be fun, but I was really looking forward to a more relaxed evening.' Alex suggests reconsidering and picking something more relaxing. Monica and Bob exchange glances, clearly still uncertain.
scenes.description: Monica sighs and looks at you, 'So, Alex, what are we going to do? We need a decision soon.' Bob nods in agreement, but you can sense the frustration in his eyes.

options.text: Maybe we should just go with the flow and see how things unfold.
options.analysis: This response is abstract and non-committal, showing balanced emotional detection but lacking a clear direction.

options.text: You know, a relaxed evening might be just what we need after all this hard work. Let's go for the formal dinner.
options.analysis: This response leans toward agreement, showing good self-regulation and social skills, but slightly lower empathy as it prioritizes a single suggestion.
